physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 60/20 mm Hg (during hypotensive episode)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Single, approximately 8-cm-diameter round, smooth-surfaced, fluctuant, tender mass on the vertex of the scalp without overlying skin changes or purulent drainage. No focal neurological deficits noted.
CT scan revealed a 4-cm osteolytic lesion in the right frontoparietal skull, a hyperdense epidural fluid collection, and a low-density lesion in the right frontal lobe surrounded by vasogenic edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, CT scanning showed complete resection of the lesion.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Axial CT scan showed repair of the cranial defect with custom-fabricated implant and no recurrence of contrast-enhancing lesion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lung lesion had nearly resolved at 9 months post-surgery.
The patient was clinically stable without evidence of disease recurrence, and incisions were healed.
